Citation.sTitle: Solid liquid phase equilibria in the systems K2SO4 MSO4 H2O (M= Co, Ni, Cu) from ambient to enhanced temperatures
Citation.sAbstract: Reviewing the literature solubility isotherms in the ternary systemsK2SO4 MSO4 H2O(M= Co, Ni, Cu, Zn) revealed a lack at ambient temperatures. The solid liquid phase equilibria have been determined in the systems K2SO4 MSO4 H2O (M= Co, Ni, Cu) at T = 313 K. With increasing bivalent metal sulfate concentration, the solubility of potassium sulfate rises until the two-salt point is reached. Reciprocally, the solubility of the bivalent metal sulfate hydrates (CoSO4*7H2O, -NiSO4*6H2O, CuSO4*5H2O) increases with rising potassium sulfate concentration. In all three systems the double salts of Tutton s type K2SO4*MSO4*6H2O (M= Co, Ni, Cu) are formed.
